title: Very disappointed with the lack of continuity!!!
body:
The Poro's are not blocked by the wind wall because they are 'animals' not 'spells', so using that logic Azir's Soldiers, Bard's Meeps, Maokai's Saplings, Janna's wind elemental, Kindred's E (Wolf), and Swain's Ravenous flock of ravens. should all not be blocked too.

The arguable exceptions would be that Azir's soldiers are not 'animals' but they are still life forms and they do move under their own steam (e.g.. not a projectile by definition) and Maokai's saplings are technically 'plants' not animals, but they are basically the same thing in this case.

but for all the rest there should be no excuse!

if you're going to make stuff up to justify the things that you do, at least make it consistent.

[EDIT]:
just to clarify after some misunderstanding, this is not a complaint this is a philosophical problem about wording.

replies.body: You must be bored to complain about something so stupid.

My friend, i could never be bored while talking to you.

the really sad thing tho  is that you're here complaining about me complaining about something so stupid.

which really isn't even that stupid or a complaint, wording is important, loose lips sink ships.
Im bored so im complaining about you complaining about something stupid.
we are two of a kind

But Azir's soldiers would be considered animals, after all they're not plants, fungi, bacteria, virus' or non-biological, so it makes sense for them. Also, Valor is an animal and is still blocked by the ability (come on Rito).

As for Maokai's Saplings, the ability states nothing in regards to plants and, while they could be considered in the same category as animals in the sense they are living beings, they're still not animals. And as for Janna's wind elemental, there's not much clarity on how exactly Riot defines them. Are they a form of magical animal or are they non-biological altogether?

That said, what about abilities that use body parts of champions (specifically, champions which are defined as animals in one way or another), such as Tahm Kench's Tongue Lash?

And if we were to include plants would that mean all of Zyra's abilities would be immune to wind walls and spell shields?

There is little consistency with this ability description amongst the rest of the game.

You are right about Azir they are animals, although they are technically necromancy summonings, (so at least 'used' to be animals) so I'm not sure if that affects the process.

True about Maokai, although the saplings are indeed blocked by the wall during flight, and seeming they are neither animal (because they are plants) or projectile (because they are living beings) there must be is something missing in the description that prevents flying non-projectile plants from passing through the wall.

True about Janna, information is lacking, but seeming it is a self propelled organism it cant be a 'projectile' yet it is blocked by the wall that blocks 'projectiles' so therefore something must be amiss.

As for body parts, as long as it is still connected to the original e.g.  Blitz pull, Tahm Q, Thresh Hook. it technically isn't a projectile so therefore they should pass through the wall, but they don't. which confuses me.

As for Zyra's plants, Her spitting plants couldnt spit through the wall because plant matter or not the bolts are still non-living non-connected projectiles. However her snaring Roots should indeed pass through the wall because they are living organisms and are not only self propelled but travel along the ground so therefore they cant be classed as projectile under any means, and so therefore shouldn't be blocked.

You raise some good points!

> You are right about Azir they are animals, although they are technically necromancy summonings, (so at least 'used' to be animals) so I'm not sure if that affects the process.

Still animals though, just dead (or, rather, undead).
and are any of those summoner spells?
The description gives the reason that Poros are animals, not that they are summoner spells, as to why they ignore spell shields and wind walls.
my justification. The valor quinn throws is actually a rubber chew toy.
